Package sammish93.tbage.models

Class Enemy

java.lang.Object
sammish93.tbage.models.NonPlayableCharacter
sammish93.tbage.models.Enemy
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable
public class Enemy extends NonPlayableCharacter
A class intended to be used in a CombatEncounter. Enemies can take part in combat with the player, cast abilities, and drop currency and loot on being defeated.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • create

      public static Enemy create() throws InvalidValueException
      Returns:
      Returns an initialised Enemy object with a default UUID value as a name, maximum and current health as 10, minimum damage as 1, maximum damage as 2, currency received on death as 0, and a melee chance of 100%.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Thrown when a non-positive value is set for maximum health, or a negative value is set for minimum damage, maximum damage, or currency received on death, or a decimal value less than 0 or greater than 1 is set for melee chance per turn.

    • create

      public static Enemy create(String name) throws InvalidValueException
      Parameters:
      name - A string that is used as an identifier for this enemy.
      Returns:
      Returns an initialised Enemy object with a default maximum and current health as 10, minimum damage as 1, maximum damage as 2, currency received on death as 0, and a melee chance of 100%.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Thrown when a non-positive value is set for maximum health, or a negative value is set for minimum damage, maximum damage, or currency received on death, or a decimal value less than 0 or greater than 1 is set for melee chance per turn.

    • create

      public static Enemy create(String name, int health, int minDamage, int maxDamage, double goldReceivedOnDeath, TreeMap<String,Ability> abilities, TreeMap<String,Item> items, String enemyType, boolean isMelee, double meleeChancePerTurn) throws InvalidValueException
      Parameters:
      name - A string representing the name of an Enemy object.
      health - A positive integer value representing the maximum and current health of an enemy.
      minDamage - A non-negative integer value that determines the minimum damage that an enemy can inflict upon attacking a Player.
      maxDamage - A non-negative integer value that determines the maximum damage that an enemy can inflict upon attacking a Player.
      goldReceivedOnDeath - A non-negative decimal that determines how much gold an Enemy drops upon being defeated.
      abilities - An existing TreeMap representing the abilities that an Enemy can use during combat.
      items - An existing TreeMap representing the items that an Enemy can drop upon being defeated. Note that these items aren't guaranteed to drop.
      enemyType - A string value that has no pre-programmed use in the framework, but can be used to group enemies, and optionally be used within the generic Useable interface. Example: Enemies with an enemyType of 'undead' might take more damage from an item's onUse() method.
      meleeChancePerTurn - A decimal value greater than or equal to 0, or less than or equal to 1. An enemy that has a value of 1 is guaranteed to use a melee attack each turn, while an enemy with a value of 0.5 and existing abilities in their ability pool has a 50% chance of attacking that turn, or a 50% chance of using an ability.
      Returns:
      Returns an initialised Enemy object.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Thrown when a non-positive value is set for maximum health, or a negative value is set for minimum damage, maximum damage, or currency received on death, or a decimal value less than 0 or greater than 1 is set for melee chance per turn.

    • getEnemyType

      public String getEnemyType()
      Returns:
      Returns a string value representing the type of enemy.

    • setEnemyType

      public void setEnemyType(String enemyType)
      Parameters:
      enemyType - Sets a string value representing the type of enemy that has no pre-programmed use in the framework, but can be used to group enemies, and optionally be used within the generic Useable interface. Example: Enemies with an enemyType of 'undead' might take more damage from an item's onUse() method.

    • isMelee

      public boolean isMelee()
      Returns:
      Returns true if the enemy has a chance to attack via melee per turn.

    • setMelee

      public void setMelee(boolean melee)
      Parameters:
      melee - Sets a boolean value to determine if an enemy will attack via melee each turn.

    • getMeleeChancePerTurn

      public double getMeleeChancePerTurn()
      Returns:
      Returns a decimal value representing the chance a melee attack will be chosen per turn.

    • setMeleeChancePerTurn

      public void setMeleeChancePerTurn(double meleeChancePerTurn) throws InvalidValueException
      Parameters:
      meleeChancePerTurn - Sets the probability that a melee attack will be chosen per turn. If the value is 1 then an enemy is guaranteed to attack via melee. If it is 0.5 then there's a 50% chance it will attack via melee, providing there exists abilities in the ability pool. If it is a positive value less than or equal to 1 and there are no abilities in the ability pool then the enemy is guaranteed to attack via melee.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Thrown in the event that a value is provided that is less than 0 or greater than 1.

    • isMeleeAttackThisTurn

      public boolean isMeleeAttackThisTurn()
      This method is intended to be used by the EncounterController class during runtime.
      Returns:
      Returns whether an enemy will attack via melee on a specific turn.
      See Also:
      • EncounterController

    • getEnemyHealthStatus

      public String getEnemyHealthStatus()
      This method is intended to return non-exact representations of an enemy's current health.
      Returns:
      Returns a string that vaguely describes the health status of an enemy. An enemy progresses from 'Fully Health' to 'Slightly Injured' to 'Injured' to 'Close to Death' to 'Dead' depending on their current health compared to max health.

    • subtractFromCurrentHealth

      Parameters:
      i - A positive integer value.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Thrown in the event of a negative value being provided.
